resources.string: What would you like to learn about the city?
"The Coca-Cola Museum showing the history up to the crazy flavors available."
"The place where they trucked a whale through downtown for."
Address: 660 West Peachtree St NW\nAtlanta, GA 30308
"The Fabulous Fox Theatre that has graced the streets of Peachtree St. since the 1930s."

"The mythical overpass that was the site of an uncanny bridge collapse due to a fire first started by a flaming shopping cart that ignited a stockpile of plastic conduit, blazing forth with flame of death and destruction. The subsequent fallout from the event led to rapid decent into bedlam, and eventual collapse of the city itself. A tale that will forever be repeated by the bards in dark corners of the planet, having attained a status the likes of Sherman himself."
Address: 224 Ponce De Leon Ave NE\nAtlanta, GA 30308
Address: 1000 Robert E Lee Blvd, Stone Mountain, GA 30083
"Being just a half hour away from the downtown section of the city, the park is a great place to go hiking and provides a great view of the surrounding area from the top."
Address: 400 Park Dr NE, Atlanta, GA 30309
"This park is located right in the midtown area and is easily within walking distance from most working areas of midtown. It has one of the best scenic spots that the city can offer."
This is an initiative of the city to connect areas better with well-kept walking and biking trails. As it has grown, businesses and shops have all sprouted up around it.
"The is a popular breakfast spot located just north of Georgia Tech's campus. It's a small diner that's been around for decades and continues to make one of the best breakfasts in town."
Address: 61 North Avenue NW, Atlanta, GA 30308
"A classic dining spot that's famous for its greasy food and snappy cashiers. Located just east of Georgia Tech's campus, it's a popular spot for the young and old alike."
Address: North Ave NW, Atlanta, GA 30332
"The greatest university the world has ever seen - fact."
Address: 515 N McDonough St, Decatur, GA 30030
"A popular music spot to see up and coming artists. Some of the ones who got their start here were John Mayer, Clay Cook, Shawn Mullins, Jennifer Nettles, and more."
Address: 275 Riverside Parkway Southwest, Austell, GA 30168
"The roller coaster packed amusement park located west of the city. It's close/cheap enough to go do easily one evening but also big enough to have plenty to do while you're there."
